meta.name: description
meta.content: Lincoln Unified School District is located in Stockton, CA.

li.a: Family Resources for Kids at Home

div.p:
The LUSD District Office will be open Tuesdays & Thursdays from 8:00 a.m.
until 11:00 a.m. This is subject to change.

div.div: Our mission is to provide a quality education through shared responsibility in a safe supportive environment for all students to meet the challenges of a global society.
The LUSD District Office will be open Tuesdays & Thursdays from 8:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m. This is subject to change.

img.alt: Census 2020: There's still time! Featured Photo

div.div: You can respond to the 2020 Census online at https://my2020census.gov.
In this letter you will find information related to school closures as well as how to access materials and resources your student(s) need for learning from home while school is not in session.

Here you will find guidance and resources to support your student, in grades preschool through grade eight. We want your student(s) to be engaged in learning activities every day while they are away from school.

h3.a: Family Resources for kids at home

div.div: Click here to find a variety of resources and tools to help parents and guardians navigate the school closures with your children. We will continue to add information and resources as they become available.
Please fill out request form if you are in need of technology.
Location: DR Multi-Use Room 6110 Brookside Road Stockton, CA

div.div: Location: LHS Performing Arts Center 4844 Alexandria Stockton, CA

li.div: Extended Day Programs at all Elementary Schools
Preschool classes at All Elementary Schools
All students have access to Chromebooks and iPads. 1:1 Chromebooks for all students in grades 2-12:
Diverse student community: 12.7% African American, 0.5% American Indian, 9.7% Asian, 3.5% Filipino, 47.9% Hispanic, 3.1% two or more races, 1.2% Pacific Islander, 21.2% White

div.div: Welcome to Lincoln Unified School District. Every one of our schools is ready to provide a high–quality education for all of our students. We are focused on assuring that students are prepared with a 21st century education that will allow them to be college and career ready upon graduating from high school. All of our students will have access to state-of-the-art technology as well as rigorous and engaging academic content. Programs have been designed to meet the many needs and interests of our students and families. All of our schools provide strong standards-based instruction, the opportunity for accelerated learning, interventions when needed, and other services such as counseling, mental health services, special education services and service for English learners. Supported by the Board of Trustees, we have taken great effort to ensure safe schools, including School Safety Officers at every site. We are proud to be LUSD!
